Berawal dari Pengguna, Franka Franklin Terjun ke Bisnis Perhiasan
05 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Cantika.com, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Franka Franklin diam-diam punya intuisi bisnis yang kuat seperti sang suami, Nadiem Makarim, pendiri Gojek yang kini jadi Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan RI. Franka memiliki riwayat karier gemilang dalam bidang retail selama 10 tahun. Memulai dari Time International, Kanmo Retail Group, Luxola.com, dan terakhir e-commerce Berrybenka.
Tiga tahun belakangan, ibu satu putri ini memilih berinvestasi di bisnis perhiasan Tulola yang didirikan oleh Happy Salma dan Sri Luce Rusna. Pilihannya untuk berbisnis diawali dari kegemarannya memakai koleksi Tulola.
Ia bercerita, bisnisnya di industri perhiasan dimulai dari pertemuannya dengan Sri, 12 tahun yang lalu. Ia kebetulan kenal lama dengan desainer perhiasan itu. Franka dan Nadiem Makarim juga berteman dengan Happy.
“Sebagai teman, saya udah jadi fans Tulola tuh, udah lama banget. Satu hal yang konsisten dari dulu sampai sekarang saya perhatikan adalah story telling dan kekuatan dari produk-produk itu sendiri,” ungkap Franka Franklin saat ditemui di acara pembukaan butik keempat Tulola di Plaza Indonesia, Jakarta Pusat, Rabu, 30 Oktober 2019.
Tapi, ia bergabung dengan bisnis perhiasan ini bukan karena pertemanan. Ia benar-benar ingin berinvestasi dan bekerja lebih lanjut untuk pengembangan brand perhiasan ini.
Menurut Franka, Tulola punya ciri khas brand yang selalu dipertahankan selama satu dekade. “Satu yang saya tahu dan penting sekali untuk brand adalah kekuatan dari cerita itu sendiri, which is branding. Tapi yang kedua juga dari segi produk atau produksi,” ujar Franka Franklin.
SILVY RIANA PUTRI

Starting from the User, Franka Franklin Plunges into the Jewelry Business
05 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Cantika.com, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Franka Franklin secretly has strong business intuition as her husband, Nadiem Makarim, founder of Gojek who is now the Minister of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia. Franka has a ten-year history of a successful career in retail. Starting from Time International, Kanmo Retail Group, Luxola.com, and finally Berrybenka e-commerce.
For the past three years, the mother of one daughter has chosen to invest in the Tulola jewelry business, which was founded by Happy Salma and Sri Luce Rusna. His choice to do business began with his penchant for the Tulola collection.
He said, his business in the jewelry industry began from his meeting with Sri, 12 years ago. He happened to know a long time with the jewelry designer. Franka and Nadiem Makarim are also friends with Happy.
"As a friend, I've become a Tulola fan, it's been a long time. One thing that is consistent from the beginning until now I have noticed is the story telling and the strength of the products themselves, "Franka Franklin said when met at the opening ceremony of the fourth boutique Tulola at Plaza Indonesia, Central Jakarta, Wednesday, 30 October 2019.
But, he joined the jewelry business not because of friendship. He really wants to invest and work further for the development of this jewelry brand.
According to Franka, Tulola has a trademark that has always been maintained for a decade. "One that I know and is very important for brands is the power of the story itself, which is branding. But the second is also in terms of products or production, "said Franka Franklin.
SILVY RIANA PRINCESS
